term.name: ENERGY STAR Label
term.description: Indicate whether the product has earned the ENERGY STAR label.

term.name: ENERGY STAR Version Number
term.description: List the version number of the most current ENERGY STAR specification under which the product earned the ENERGY STAR label.
term.tp_additional_web_dev_info: Values should include a tenths place digit (e.g., "4.0", or "5.1").

term.name: FEMP Designated Product
term.description: Indicate whether the product currently meets the energy performance requirements necessary to be identified as a Federal Energy Management Program-designated product.

term.name: AHRI Certified Reference Number
term.description: Reference number for products certified under the AHRI Unitary Large Equipment, Unitary Air Conditioner Equipment, or Unitary Heat Pump Equipment certification program.

term.name: Nominal Cooling Capacity
term.description: The nominal (net) cooling capacity of the unit at rated conditions.

term.name: Energy Efficiency Ratio
term.description: "A ratio of the Cooling Capacity in Btu/h to the power input values in watts at any given set of rating conditions expressed in Btu/W·h." (AHRI 340/360 2007)
term.ip_written: British Thermal Units per hour per Watt
term.si_written: British Thermal Units per hour per Watt

term.name: Integrated Energy Efficiency Ratio
term.description: "A single number cooling part-load efficiency figure of merit." (AHRI 340/360 2007)
term.ip_written: British Thermal Units per hour per Watt
term.si_written: British Thermal Units per hour per Watt

term.name: Seasonal Energy Efficiency Ratio
term.description: "The total heat removed from the conditioned space during the annual cooling season, expressed in Btu's, divided by the total electrical energy consumed by the air conditioner or heat pump during the same season, expressed in watt-hours." (AHRI 210/240 2008)
term.ip_written: British Thermal Units per hour per Watt
term.si_written: British Thermal Units per hour per Watt

term.name: Cooling Mode: Supply Fan Speed Control
term.description: The supply-fan speed control for the unit, when it is in cooling mode. Select "Constant Speed" for units that operate at a single, constant speed. Select "Stepped Speed" for units that operate at multiple discrete steps. Select "Variable Speed" for variable speed control.

term.name: Cooling Mode: Number of Discrete Fan Speeds
term.description: The number of discrete operating speeds for the supply-fan motor when the unit is in cooling mode, excluding "off."
term.tp_additional_web_dev_info: This line is only shown if the answer to "Cooling Mode: Indoor Fan Speed Control" is "Stepped Speed"

term.name: Cooling Mode: Minimum Fan Speed as a Fraction of Maximum
term.description: The minimum fan RPM (when in cooling mode) divided by the maximum fan RPM (when in cooling mode).
term.tp_additional_web_dev_info: This line is only shown if the answer to "Cooling Mode: Indoor Fan Speed Control" is "Stepped Speed" or "Variable Speed"

term.name: Heating Mode: Supply Fan Speed Control
term.description: The supply-fan speed control for the unit, when it is in heating mode. Select "Constant Speed" for units that operate at a single, constant speed. Select "Stepped Speed" for units that operate at multiple discrete steps. Select "Variable Speed" for variable speed control.

term.name: Heating Mode: Number of Discrete Fan Speeds
term.description: The number of discrete operating speeds for the supply-fan motor when the unit is in heating mode, excluding "off."
term.tp_additional_web_dev_info: This line is only shown if the answer to "Heating Mode: Indoor Fan Speed Control" is "Stepped Speed"

term.name: Heating Mode: Minimum Fan Speed as a Fraction of Maximum
term.description: The minimum fan RPM (when in heating mode) divided by the maximum fan RPM (when in heating mode).
term.tp_additional_web_dev_info: This line is only shown if the answer to "Heating Mode: Indoor Fan Speed Control" is "Stepped Speed" or "Variable Speed"

term.name: Internal Static Pressure at Full Speed
term.description: Internal static pressure of the unit at full supply fan speed including all filters, coils, and accessories used in this model.

term.name: Compressor Staging
term.description: The compressor staging for the unit. Select "Single Stage" for units with single stage (on/off) control. Select "Multiple, Discrete Stages" for units with multiple compressors, discrete unloading stages, or compressors with stepped speed motors that are controlled to operate at discrete stages. Select "Variable" for compressors that operate at variable speeds or with modulating unloading.

term.name: Number of Discrete Cooling Stages
term.description: The number of discrete operating stages for the compressors, excluding "off."
term.tp_additional_web_dev_info: This line is only shown if the answer to "Compressor Staging" is "Multiple, discrete stages"

term.name: Degradation Coefficient
term.description: "Degradation Coefficient (CD). The measure of the efficiency loss due to the cycling of the units as determined in Appendices C and D [of the standard]." (AHRI 210/240 2008)

term.name: Refrigerant
term.description: The type of refrigerant used in the unit.

term.name: Active Dehumidification
term.description: "Yes" indicates that the unit contains an active dehumidification system (in addition to the dehumidification that takes place during normal DX cooling operation).

term.name: Evaporatively Cooled Condenser
term.description: "Yes" indicates that the unit uses evaporative cooling to enhance heat rejection from the condenser coils.

term.name: Minimum Outdoor Dry-Bulb for Cooling Operation
term.description: This is the minimum outdoor dry-bulb temperature at which the DX cooling coils are able to operate.

term.name: Maximum Outdoor Dry-Bulb for Cooling Operation
term.description: This is the maximum outdoor dry-bulb temperature at which the DX cooling coils are able to operate.

term.name: Condenser Fan Speed Operation
term.description: The condenser fan control option used by the unit. If the unit has several constant-speed condenser fans that stage on in conjunction with multiple compressors, this should be set to "Stepped Speed."

term.name: Air-Source Heat Pump
term.description: "Yes" indicates that this unit is a "Commercial and Industrial Unitary Heat Pump. One or more factory-made assemblies, which normally include an indoor conditioning coil, an air moving device, compressor(s), and an outdoor coil(s), including means to provide a heating Function and may or may not include a cooling Function." (AHRI 340/360 2007)

term.name: Minimum Outdoor Dry-Bulb for Heat Pump Operation
term.description: This is the minimum outdoor dry-bulb temperature at which the DX coils are able to operate (in heating mode) during heat pump operation.
term.tp_additional_web_dev_info: This input only appears if the answer to "Air-Source Heat Pump" is "Yes"

term.name: Maximum Outdoor Dry-Bulb for Heat Pump Operation
term.description: This is the maximum outdoor dry-bulb temperature at which the DX coils are able to operate (in heating mode) during heat pump operation.
term.tp_additional_web_dev_info: This input only appears if the answer to "Air-Source Heat Pump" is "Yes"

term.name: Type of Heating
term.description: The method of heating that the unit uses. This is independent of heat pump operation. If this unit is an air-source heat pump without supplemental heating, or has no heating coil/furnace section, select "None."

term.name: Heating Staging
term.description: The method of heating staging used by the unit. Select "Single Stage" for units with single stage (on/off) control. Select "Multiple, Discrete Stages" for units with multiple discrete stages (low-fire / high-fire). Select "Modulating" for units which contain modulating burners.
term.tp_additional_web_dev_info: This input only appears if the answer to "Type of Heating" is "Gas" or "Electric"

term.name: Number of Heating Stages
term.description: The number of heating stages, excluding "off."
term.tp_additional_web_dev_info: This line only appears if the answer to "Heating Staging" is "Multiple, discrete stages"

term.name: Burner Turndown Ratio
term.description: If applicable, the turndown ratio for the burner (full input/minimum input).
term.tp_additional_web_dev_info: This line only appears if the answer to "Heating Staging" is "Multiple, discrete stages" or "Modulating"

term.name: Economizer Control Types Available
term.description: The economizer control options available for this model.

term.name: Maximum OA Flow Rate
term.description: The maximum flow rate of outside air that the RTU is able to deliver. For models with economizing or DCV capability, this is the outdoor air flow rate when the OA damper is fully open and the fan speed is at maximum.

term.name: Performance Map
term.description: A document detailing the RTU's performance under various conditions. The information must be formatted in alignment with the provided template, and uploaded as an .xls.
term.tp_additional_web_dev_info: Append a distinct number on the end of the performance map name if duplicate names are uploaded (e.g., "Brand Model#_1.xls". This may happen if two sets of data are uploaded for the same product. Remove any special characters that may appear in the file name.
term.tp_additional_data_user_info: The performance map provides performance characterisitics under various operating conditions to enable a detailed analysis.
term.tp_additional_data_submitter_info: The name of the xls file should be entered as "Brand Model#.xls".

term.name: RTU Control Documentation
term.description: A document describing the unit's typical sequence of operation (SOO) and/or other control-related information. The document must be formatted as a PDF.

term.name: Product Data Sheet
term.description: A document that provides additional product performance-related information. Such documents may contain energy performance data, mounting diagrams, dimensions, a description of factory options/accessories, or other technical details about the product. This information must be formatted as a PDF file.
term.tp_additional_web_dev_info: Needs to be formatted as a PDF.

level_2.name: Pumps
level_2.description: The Pump subgroup includes products whose primary function is to "distribute and recirculate hot and chilled water in a variety of space-conditioning systems" (2012 ASHRAE Handbook - HVAC Systems and Equipment).

level_3.name: Rotodynamic Pumps
level_3.description: Products found in this technology category "are kinetic machines in which energy is continuously imparted to the pumped fluid by means of a rotating impeller, propeller, or rotor. The most common types of rotodynamic pumps are centrifugal (radial), mixed flow, and axial flow pumps" (ANSI HI Standard 1.3-2009).

term.name: OpenStudio Type
term.description: Type of OpenStudio Object

term.name: Manufacturer/Brand Owner
term.description: The name of the company that manufactures the product and/or that owns the product brand.

term.name: Brand
term.description: The brand name under which the submitted product is marketed and/or sold in the U.S. In some cases, this may be identical to the name of the manufacturer/brand owner.

term.name: Product Line/Family Name
term.description: If the product being submitted is part of a family of products or models, supply the product line or family name here. As an example, if the submission were an automobile, this field would contain the model name.

term.name: Model Number
term.description:
The unique model number used by the manufacturer/brand owner to identify the specific product being submitted to the Technology Performance Exchange. Sometimes referred to as "catalog number."
Model numbers should be entered in the same style as that used by the manufacturer/brand owner, including all applicable slashes (/) and dashes (-). If certain alphanumeric characters in the model number identify product variations that do not impact energy performance, please replace each of those alphanumeric characters with an asterisk (*) when entering the model number on this website. This convention reduces the need to submit separate forms for product variations that have identical performance data. However, if a subset, but not all options for a specific character in the model number do not affect energy performance, include all such options inside parentheses within the larger model/product number.
Example: Product family X uses product numbers that contain eight alphanumeric characters. The first three characters denote product variations that affect energy performance; a subset of options denoted by the fourth character do not affect performance; and the last four characters do not affect energy performance at all. The manufacturer/brand owner would submit a separate "Add Product" form for each unique combination of the first four characters that affect energy performance; on each form, the submitted model numbers would have the form: ABC(1,2,3)****, ABC4****, ABC5****, etc.

term.name: Universal Product Code
term.description: If provided, the user must submit all 12 digits without spaces or dashes.

term.name: ENERGY STAR Label
term.description: Indicate whether the product has earned the ENERGY STAR label.

term.name: ENERGY STAR Version Number
term.description: List the version number of the most current ENERGY STAR specification under which the product earned the ENERGY STAR label.
term.tp_additional_web_dev_info: Values should include a tenths place digit (e.g., "4.0", or "5.1").

term.name: FEMP Designated Product
term.description: Indicate whether the product currently meets the energy performance requirements necessary to be identified as a Federal Energy Management Program-designated product.

term.name: Rated Flow Rate
term.description: The rated maximum flow rate of the pump.

term.name: Rated Pump Head
term.description: The rated maximum head of the pump.

term.name: Maximum Impeller Diameter
term.description: The maximum impeller diameter that is offered with the pump.

term.name: Minimum Impeller Diameter
term.description: The minimum impeller diameter that is offered with the pump.

term.name: Maximum Pump Speed
term.description: The maximum RPM at which the pump is designed to operate.

term.name: Minimum Pump Speed
term.description: The minimum RPM at which the pump is designed to operate.

term.name: Pump Type and Classification
term.description: The pump type and classification identifies the mechanical configuration using the impeller and casing arrangement.</ br> � OH represents Overhung Pump types</ br> o OH11 through OH3A represent Flexibly Coupled OH types</ br> o OH4 represents the Rigidly Coupled OH type</ br> o OH5 through OH10 represent Close Coupled OH types</ br> � BB represents Between-Bearings pump types</ br> o BB1 and BB2 both represent 1 & 2 stage BB types</ br> o BB3 through BB5 represent Multistage BB types</ br> � VS represents Vertically Suspended Pump types</ br> o VS0 through VS5 represent Single Casing VS types</ br> o VS6 and VS7 represent Double Casing types</ br> o VS8 represents the In-Line Casing type</ br> Further identification of pump types and classifications can be found in ANSI/HI Standard 1.3-2009.

enumerations.enumeration: OH11 - Overhung Impeller, Flexibly-Coupled, Sealless with Magnetic Drive, Horizontal
OH12 - Overhung Impeller, Flexibly-Coupled, Sealless with Magnetic Drive, Vertical
OH00 - Overhung Impeller, Flexibly-Coupled, Horizontal, Axial Flow
OH0 - Overhung Impeller, Flexibly-Coupled, Horizontal, Frame-Mounted
OH1 - Overhung Impeller, Flexibly-Coupled, Horizontal, Foot-Mounted
OH1A - Overhung Impeller, Flexibly-Coupled, Horizontal, Foot-Mounted, Self-Priming
OH2 - Overhung Impeller, Flexibly-Coupled, Horizontal, Centerline-Mounted
OH3 - Overhung Impeller, Flexibly-Coupled, Vertical, In-Line
OH3A - Overhung Impeller, Flexibly-Coupled, Vertical, End Suction
OH4 - Overhung Impeller, Rigidly-Coupled, Vertical, In-Line
OH5 - Overhung Impeller, Close-Coupled, Vertical, In-Line
OH5A - Overhung Impeller, Close-Coupled, Vertical, End Suction
OH6 - Overhung Impeller, Close-Coupled, High-Speed Integral Gear
OH8A - Overhung Impeller, Close-Coupled, Submersible, Diffuser
OH8B - Overhung Impeller, Close-Coupled, Submersible, Volute
OH9 - Overhung Impeller, Close-Coupled, Sealless with Canned Motor, Horizontal
OH10 - Overhung Impeller, Close-Coupled, Sealless with Canned Motor, Vertical
BB1 - Impeller Between Bearings, Flexibly-Coupled, Single-Stage, Axial (Horizontal) Split Case
BB2 - Impeller Between Bearings, Flexibly-Coupled, Single-Stage, Radial Split Case
BB3 - Impeller Between Bearings, Flexibly-Coupled, Multistage, Axial (Horizontal) Split Case
BB4 - Impeller Between Bearings, Flexibly-Coupled, Multistage, Radial Split, Single Case
BB5 - Impeller Between Bearings, Flexibly-Coupled, Multistage, Radial Split, Double Casing
VS0 - Vertically Suspended, Single Casing, Submersible
VS1 - Vertically Suspended, Single Casing, Discharge Through Column, Diffuser
VS2 - Vertically Suspended, Single Casing, Discharge Through Column, Volute
VS3 - Vertically Suspended, Single Casing, Discharge Through Column, Axial Flow
VS4 - Vertically Suspended, Single Casing, Separate Discharge (Sump), Line Shaft
VS5 - Vertically Suspended, Single Casing, Separate Discharge (Sump), Cantilever
VS6 - Vertically Suspended, Double Casing, Diffuser
VS7 - Vertically Suspended, Double Casing, Volute
VS8 - Vertically Suspended, In-Line Casing, Diffuser

term.name: Integrated Motor
term.description: This parameter identifies whether the pump is provided with an integrated electric motor. If various motor options are available for a given pump, and motor selection does not impact the pump model number, then the answer provided here should be "No." If selection of the motor does modify the pump model number, then this parameter should be set to "Yes."

term.name: Rated Motor Power
term.description: This is the nominal nameplate motor power for pumps that are provided with an integrated motor.
term.tp_additional_web_dev_info: This input only appears if the answer to "Integrated Motor" is "Yes"

term.name: Motor Voltage
term.description: This is the nominal nameplate motor voltage for pumps that are provided with an integrated motor.
term.tp_additional_web_dev_info: This input only appears if the answer to "Integrated Motor" is "Yes"

term.name: Minimum Fluid Temperature
term.description: The minimum fluid temperature for which the pump is designed.

term.name: Maximum Fluid Temperature
term.description: The maximum fluid temperature for which the pump is designed.

term.name: Maximum System Operating Pressure
term.description: The maximum system operating pressure for which the pump is designed.

term.name: Test Acceptance Grade
term.description: "Pump performance acceptance grades for flow, head, efficiency, and power are used in ANSI/HI 14.6 when evaluating acceptance of a pump for a guarantee point.Six pump performance test acceptance grades are used: 1B, 1E, 1U, 2B, 2U, and 3B. Grade 1 is the most stringent grade, the "U" specifies having a unilateral tolerance band, and the "B" specifies having a bilateral tolerance band. Acceptance grade 1E can be used when energy efficiency is of importance, and is also bilateral" (Benefits of Hydraulic Institute's New Test Standard for Rotodynamic Pumps).

term.name: Pump Industry Segment
term.description: This parameter identifies the appropriate pump application(s). Industry segment applications can overlap. All that apply should be selected. (ANSI/HI Standard 14.6-2011)

term.name: Product Data Sheet
term.description: A document that provides additional product performance-related information. Such documents may contain energy performance data, mounting diagrams, dimensions, a description of factory options/accessories, or other technical details about the product. This information must be formatted as a PDF.

term.name: Pump Performance Curve
term.description: A document that provides a graphical representation of the pump performance curves for the minimum to maximum impeller sizes for the minimum and maximum pump speed ranging from no flow to full flow, formatted as a PDF.

term.name: Performance Map
term.description: A data map which details the pump's performance under various conditions, using water at the standard condition of 20.2 C. The performance map system boundary is the pump only and excludes pump motors or other drive apparatuses (even if integrated). All references in the performance map to "input torque" refer to the torque applied to the pump shaft.

term.description: Type of OpenStudio Object

term.name: Peak Power
term.description: The peak power drawn by this piece of equipment. This may either be measured or nameplate rated.

term.name: Cycling Percent On
term.description: The percent of time that this piece of equipment is in the on state. Equipment is assumed to be in standby mode when not on.

term.name: Standby Power
term.description: The power drawn by this piece of equipment when not in the on state. This value is measured.

level_1.name: On-Site Power Generation
level_1.description: Technology categories contained in the On-Site Power Generation group include products used to generate, transform, transmit, or otherwise support the generation of electricity on or near the building or campus that is the intended electricity end-user.

level_2.name: Photovoltaic System
level_2.description: The Photovoltaic System subgroup includes products whose primary function is generate, transform, transmit, or otherwise support the generation of electricity from the sun.

level_3.name: Inverter
level_3.description: This technology category includes complete and enclosed units whose primary function is to transform direct current (DC) power from solar photovoltaic modules into alternating current (AC) power. Products covered within this category may also accept input from alternative DC power sources.

term.name: OpenStudio Type
term.description: Type of OpenStudio Object

term.name: Manufacturer/Brand Owner
term.description: The name of the company that manufactures the product and/or that owns the product brand.

term.name: Brand
term.description: The brand name under which the submitted product is marketed and/or sold in the U.S. In some cases, this may be identical to the name of the manufacturer/brand owner.

term.name: Product Line/Family Name
term.description: If the product being submitted is part of a family of products or models, supply the product line or family name here. As an example, if the submission were an automobile, this field would contain the model name.

term.name: Model Number
term.description:
The unique model number used by the manufacturer/brand owner to identify the specific product being submitted to the Technology Performance Exchange. Sometimes referred to as "catalog number."
Model numbers should be entered in the same style as that used by the manufacturer/brand owner, including all applicable slashes (/) and dashes (-). If certain alphanumeric characters in the model number identify product variations that do not impact energy performance, please replace each of those alphanumeric characters with an asterisk (*) when entering the model number on this website. This convention reduces the need to submit separate forms for product variations that have identical performance data. However, if a subset, but not all options for a specific character in the model number do not affect energy performance, include all such options inside parentheses within the larger model/product number.
Example: Product family X uses product numbers that contain eight alphanumeric characters. The first three characters denote product variations that affect energy performance; a subset of options denoted by the fourth character do not affect performance; and the last four characters do not affect energy performance at all. The manufacturer/brand owner would submit a separate "Add Product" form for each unique combination of the first four characters that affect energy performance; on each form, the submitted model numbers would have the form: ABC(1,2,3)****, ABC4****, ABC5****, etc.

term.name: Universal Product Code
term.description: If provided, the user must submit all 12 digits without spaces or dashes.

term.name: ENERGY STAR Label
term.description: Indicate whether the product has earned the ENERGY STAR label.

term.name: ENERGY STAR Version Number
term.description: List the version number of the most current ENERGY STAR specification under which the product earned the ENERGY STAR label.
term.tp_additional_web_dev_info: Values should include a tenths place digit (e.g., "4.0", or "5.1").

term.name: FEMP Designated Product
term.description: Indicate whether the product currently meets the energy performance requirements necessary to be identified as a Federal Energy Management Program-designated product.

term.name: Maximum Input Power
term.description: The manufacturer-specified maximum input power level that the unit can handle (Bower, et al., 2004).
term.tp_third_party_testing: Bower et al.: "Performance Test Protocol for Evaluating Inverters Used in Grid-Connected Photovolotaic Systems"

term.name: Peak Efficiency
term.description: The maximum DC to AC conversion efficiency that this inverter can provide.

term.name: Maximum Continuous Output Power
term.description: The rated maximum output power level that the unit can continuously provide (Bower, et al., 2004).
term.tp_third_party_testing: Bower et al.: "Performance Test Protocol for Evaluating Inverters Used in Grid-Connected Photovolotaic Systems"

term.name: Output Voltage(s)
term.description: The manufacturer-specified output AC voltage(s) that this unit is designed to provide (Bower, et al., 2004).
term.tp_third_party_testing: Bower et al.: "Performance Test Protocol for Evaluating Inverters Used in Grid-Connected Photovolotaic Systems"

term.name: Weighted Efficiency at 120 Volts
term.description: A commonly used representation of inverter efficiency that is calculated as a weighted average of conversion efficiency at a specified set of test points with the unit operating at 120 volts AC output. The weighting factors are applied using the high-insolation coefficients found in Table 5-5 of Bower, et al., 2004.
term.tp_third_party_testing: Bower et al.: "Performance Test Protocol for Evaluating Inverters Used in Grid-Connected Photovolotaic Systems"

term.name: Weighted Efficiency at 208 Volts
term.description: A commonly used representation of inverter efficiency that is calculated as a weighted average of conversion efficiency at a specified set of test points with the unit operating at 208 volts AC output. The weighting factors are applied using the high-insolation coefficients found in Table 5-5 of Bower, et al., 2004.
term.tp_third_party_testing: Bower et al.: "Performance Test Protocol for Evaluating Inverters Used in Grid-Connected Photovolotaic Systems"

term.name: Weighted Efficiency at 220 Volts
term.description: A commonly used representation of inverter efficiency that is calculated as a weighted average of conversion efficiency at a specified set of test points with the unit operating at 220 volts AC output. The weighting factors are applied using the high-insolation coefficients found in Table 5-5 of Bower, et al., 2004.
term.tp_third_party_testing: Bower et al.: "Performance Test Protocol for Evaluating Inverters Used in Grid-Connected Photovolotaic Systems"

term.name: Weighted Efficiency at 240 Volts
term.description: A commonly used representation of inverter efficiency that is calculated as a weighted average of conversion efficiency at a specified set of test points with the unit operating at 240 volts AC output. The weighting factors are applied using the high-insolation coefficients found in Table 5-5 of Bower, et al., 2004.
term.tp_third_party_testing: Bower et al.: "Performance Test Protocol for Evaluating Inverters Used in Grid-Connected Photovolotaic Systems"

term.name: Weighted Efficiency at 277 Volts
term.description: A commonly used representation of inverter efficiency that is calculated as a weighted average of conversion efficiency at a specified set of test points with the unit operating at 277 volts AC output. The weighting factors are applied using the high-insolation coefficients found in Table 5-5 of Bower, et al., 2004.
term.tp_third_party_testing: Bower et al.: "Performance Test Protocol for Evaluating Inverters Used in Grid-Connected Photovolotaic Systems"

term.name: Weighted Efficiency at 480 Volts
term.description: A commonly used representation of inverter efficiency that is calculated as a weighted average of conversion efficiency at a specified set of test points with the unit operating at 480 volts AC output. The weighting factors are applied using the high-insolation coefficients found in Table 5-5 of Bower, et al., 2004.
term.tp_third_party_testing: Bower et al.: "Performance Test Protocol for Evaluating Inverters Used in Grid-Connected Photovolotaic Systems"

term.name: Weighted Efficiency at 600 Volts
term.description: A commonly used representation of inverter efficiency that is calculated as a weighted average of conversion efficiency at a specified set of test points with the unit operating at 600 volts AC output. The weighting factors are applied using the high-insolation coefficients found in Table 5-5 of Bower, et al., 2004.
term.tp_third_party_testing: Bower et al.: "Performance Test Protocol for Evaluating Inverters Used in Grid-Connected Photovolotaic Systems"

term.name: Weighted Efficiency at 690 Volts
term.description: A commonly used representation of inverter efficiency that is calculated as a weighted average of conversion efficiency at a specified set of test points with the unit operating at 690 volts AC output. The weighting factors are applied using the high-insolation coefficients found in Table 5-5 of Bower, et al., 2004.
term.tp_third_party_testing: Bower et al.: "Performance Test Protocol for Evaluating Inverters Used in Grid-Connected Photovolotaic Systems"

term.name: Connection Design
term.description: The grid-connection configuration(s) for which this inverter is designed.

term.name: Output Phase
term.description: The number of phases that comprise the inverter power output.

term.name: Minimum Input Voltage
term.description: The manufacturer-specified minimum DC voltage input for the inverter (Bower, et al., 2004).
term.tp_third_party_testing: Bower et al.: "Performance Test Protocol for Evaluating Inverters Used in Grid-Connected Photovolotaic Systems"

term.name: Nominal Input Voltage
term.description: The manufacturer-specified nominal DC voltage input for the inverter (Bower, et al., 2004).
term.tp_third_party_testing: Bower et al.: "Performance Test Protocol for Evaluating Inverters Used in Grid-Connected Photovolotaic Systems"

term.name: Maximum Input Voltage
term.description: The manufacturer-specified maximum DC voltage input for the inverter (Bower, et al., 2004).
term.tp_third_party_testing: Bower et al.: "Performance Test Protocol for Evaluating Inverters Used in Grid-Connected Photovolotaic Systems"

term.name: Standby Power
term.description: The AC power consumed when the unit is in standby mode and the incoming DC power is non-zero but too low to produce usable AC power. This also represents parasitic losses during nighttime periods. (Bower, et al., 2004)
term.tp_third_party_testing: Bower et al.: "Performance Test Protocol for Evaluating Inverters Used in Grid-Connected Photovolotaic Systems"

term.name: Manufacturer's Warranty Available
term.description: Is there a manufacturer's warranty available for the module?

term.name: Warranty Time Length
term.description: If a warranty is provided, the number of years during which the warranty is held valid by the manufacturer.

term.name: Conversion Efficiency Performance Map
term.description:
A document detailing the inverter's DC to AC conversion efficiency over a range of DC input voltages (V<sub>min</sub>, V<sub>nom</sub>, and V<sub>max</sub>) for up to three separate AC output voltages. The information contained in this performance map can be used to calculate the weighted inverter efficiency. Bower et al.: "Performance Test Protocol for Evaluating Inverters Used in Grid-Connected Photovoltaic Systems" provides more information related to these parameters.
The information must be formatted in alignment with the provided template, and uploaded as a .xls.
term.tp_third_party_testing: Bower et al.: "Performance Test Protocol for Evaluating Inverters Used in Grid-Connected Photovolotaic Systems"

level_3.name: Photovoltaic Module
level_3.description: This technology category includes complete and enclosed units whose sole function is to produce electric power from non-concentrated solar energy through the use of multiple, electrically connected solar cells. Products which use concentrated solar energy to produce electricity, are meant to be integrated with the building envelope, or produce electric and thermal energy simultaneously are not included in this technology category.

term.name: OpenStudio Type
term.description: Type of OpenStudio Object

term.name: Manufacturer/Brand Owner
term.description: The name of the company that manufactures the product and/or that owns the product brand.

term.name: Brand
term.description: The brand name under which the submitted product is marketed and/or sold in the U.S. In some cases, this may be identical to the name of the manufacturer/brand owner.

term.name: Product Line/Family Name
term.description: If the product being submitted is part of a family of products or models, supply the product line or family name here. As an example, if the submission were an automobile, this field would contain the model name.

term.name: Model Number
term.description:
The unique model number used by the manufacturer/brand owner to identify the specific product being submitted to the Technology Performance Exchange. Sometimes referred to as "catalog number."
Model numbers should be entered in the same style as that used by the manufacturer/brand owner, including all applicable slashes (/) and dashes (-). If certain alphanumeric characters in the model number identify product variations that do not impact energy performance, please replace each of those alphanumeric characters with an asterisk (*) when entering the model number on this website. This convention reduces the need to submit separate forms for product variations that have identical performance data. However, if a subset, but not all options for a specific character in the model number do not affect energy performance, include all such options inside parentheses within the larger model/product number.
Example: Product family X uses product numbers that contain eight alphanumeric characters. The first three characters denote product variations that affect energy performance; a subset of options denoted by the fourth character do not affect performance; and the last four characters do not affect energy performance at all. The manufacturer/brand owner would submit a separate "Add Product" form for each unique combination of the first four characters that affect energy performance; on each form, the submitted model numbers would have the form: ABC(1,2,3)****, ABC4****, ABC5****, etc.

term.name: Universal Product Code
term.description: If provided, the user must submit all 12 digits without spaces or dashes.

term.name: ENERGY STAR Label
term.description: Indicate whether the product has earned the ENERGY STAR label.

term.name: ENERGY STAR Version Number
term.description: List the version number of the most current ENERGY STAR specification under which the product earned the ENERGY STAR label.
term.tp_additional_web_dev_info: Values should include a tenths place digit (e.g., "4.0", or "5.1").

term.name: FEMP Designated Product
term.description: Indicate whether the product currently meets the energy performance requirements necessary to be identified as a Federal Energy Management Program-designated product.

term.name: Module Efficiency
term.description: The average module efficiency measured at standard testing conditions (STC). Where STC is defined as light spectrum AM 1.5, cell temperature of 25 degrees Celsius, and irradiance of 1000 W/m<sup>2</sup> (IEC 61853-1 Standard 7.2-2010).
term.tp_third_party_testing: IEC 61853-1 Standard 7.2-2010: "Photovoltaic (PV) module performance testing and energy rating- Part 1: Irradiance and temperature performance measuremetns and power rating"

term.name: Rated Power
term.description: The module's rated, maximum-power-point power at standard testing conditions (STC) (SAM Help, 2013). Where STC is defined as light spectrum AM 1.5, cell temperature of 25 degrees Celsius, and irradiance of 1000 W/m<sup>2</sup> (IEC 61853-1 Standard 7.2-2010).
term.tp_third_party_testing: IEC 61853-1 Standard 7.2-2010: "Photovoltaic (PV) module performance testing and energy rating- Part 1: Irradiance and temperature performance measuremetns and power rating"

term.name: Cell Material/Type
term.description: A selection of all the semiconductor technologies that are used to form the solar cells within the module (SAM Help, NREL).

enumerations.enumeration: Amorphous Silicon Microcrystalline Silicon Tandem Module (a-Si/nc)

term.name: Length
term.description: The total length of the module including the frame. Length here is defined as the longest side of the module.

term.name: Width
term.description: The total width of the module including the frame. Width is here defined as the distance between the two longest module sides.

term.name: Total Number of Cells
term.description: The total number of solar cells within the module.

term.name: Number Of Cells In Series
term.description: The number of individual solar cells connected electrically in series within the module (Input Output Reference: EnergyPlus, 2013).

term.name: Solar Cell Area
term.description: The surface area of a typical solar cell found within the module. If the cell is rectangular, width is multiplied by length to obtain this value.

term.name: Nominal Operating Cell Temperature
term.description: The temperature of the cells under the following conditions: open-rack mounted, 800 W/m<sup>2</sup> total irradiance, 20 degrees Celsius ambient temperature, 1 meter per second wind speed, and no electrical load (IEC 61853-1 Standard 7.3-2010). IEC 61215 Standard 10.5-2005: "Crystalline silicon terrestrial photovoltaic (PV) modules- Design qualification and type approval" and IEC 61646 Standard 10.5-2008: "Thin-film terrestrial photovoltaic (PV) modules- Design qualification and type approval" provide test methodologies which can be used to measure these values.
term.tp_third_party_testing: IEC 61853-1 Standard 7.3-2010: "Photovoltaic (PV) module performance testing and energy rating- Part 1: Irradiance and temperature performance measuremetns and power rating", IEC 61215 Standard 10.5-2005: "Crystalline silicon terrestrial photovoltaic (PV) modules- Design qualification and type approval" and IEC 61646 Standard 10.5-2008: "Thin-film terrestrial photovoltaic (PV) modules- Design qualification and type approval"

term.name: Short Circuit Current Temperature Coefficient
term.description: "This field accounts for the fact that the module short circuit current is temperature dependent" (EnergyPlus Input Output Reference, 2013). This parameter describes the percent change in short circuit current (I<sub>sc</sub>), relative to the I<sub>sc</sub> produced at standard testing conditions (STC), per change in temperature (Photovoltaic Array Performance Model, 2004). Where STC is defined as light spectrum AM 1.5, cell temperature of 25 degrees Celsius, and irradiance of 1000 W/m<sup>2</sup> (IEC 61853-1 Standard 7.2-2010). IEC 61215 Standard 10.4-2005: "Crystalline silicon terrestrial photovoltaic (PV) modules- Design qualification and type approval" and IEC 61646 Standard 10.4-2008: "Thin-film terrestrial photovoltaic (PV) modules- Design qualification and type approval" provide test methodologies which can be used to measure these values.
term.tp_third_party_testing: IEC 61853-1 Standard 7.2-2010: "Photovoltaic (PV) module performance testing and energy rating- Part 1: Irradiance and temperature performance measuremetns and power rating", IEC 61215 Standard 10.4-2005: "Crystalline silicon terrestrial photovoltaic (PV) modules- Design qualification and type approval", and IEC 61646 Standard 10.4-2008: "Thin-film terrestrial photovoltaic (PV) modules- Design qualification and type approval"

term.name: Open Circuit Voltage Temperature Coefficient
term.description: This coefficient provides the rate of change (derivative) with respect to temperature of the module's open-circuit voltage (V<sub>oc</sub>) (King, 1997). The coefficient is normalized to the open circuit voltage measured at standard testing conditions (STC) so that the coefficient has units of percent change in V<sub>oc</sub> per degree temperature change. STC is defined as light spectrum AM 1.5, cell temperature of 25 degrees Celsius, and irradiance of 1000 W/m<sup>2</sup> (IEC 61853-1 Standard 7.2-2010). IEC 61215 Standard 10.4-2005: "Crystalline silicon terrestrial photovoltaic (PV) modules- Design qualification and type approval" and IEC 61646 Standard 10.4-2008: "Thin-film terrestrial photovoltaic (PV) modules- Design qualification and type approval" provide test methodologies which can be used to measure these values.
term.tp_third_party_testing: IEC 61853-1 Standard 7.2-2010: "Photovoltaic (PV) module performance testing and energy rating- Part 1: Irradiance and temperature performance measuremetns and power rating", IEC 61215 Standard 10.4-2005: "Crystalline silicon terrestrial photovoltaic (PV) modules- Design qualification and type approval", and IEC 61646 Standard 10.4-2008: "Thin-film terrestrial photovoltaic (PV) modules- Design qualification and type approval"

term.name: Maximum Power Temperature Coefficient
term.description: The percentage change in the maximum power point power (P<sub>mp</sub>) per degree change in temperature (SAM Help, 2013). This coefficient is normalized to the maximum power point power measured at standard testing conditions (STC). Where STC is defined as light spectrum AM 1.5, cell temperature of 25 degrees Celsius, and irradiance of 1000 W/m<sup>2</sup> (IEC 61853-1 Standard 7.2-2010). IEC 61215 Standard 10.4-2005: "Crystalline silicon terrestrial photovoltaic (PV) modules- Design qualification and type approval" and IEC 61646 Standard 10.4-2008: "Thin-film terrestrial photovoltaic (PV) modules- Design qualification and type approval" provide test methodologies which can be used to measure these values.
term.tp_third_party_testing: IEC 61853-1 Standard 7.2-2010: "Photovoltaic (PV) module performance testing and energy rating- Part 1: Irradiance and temperature performance measuremetns and power rating", IEC 61215 Standard 10.4-2005: "Crystalline silicon terrestrial photovoltaic (PV) modules- Design qualification and type approval", and IEC 61646 Standard 10.4-2008: "Thin-film terrestrial photovoltaic (PV) modules- Design qualification and type approval"

term.name: Maximum Power at LTC
term.description: The maximum power produced by the module at low temperature conditions (LTC). LTC is defined as light spectrum AM 1.5, normal incidence irradiance, cell temperature of 15 °C, and 500 W/m<sup>2</sup> irradiance (IEC 61853-1 Standard 7.6-2010).
term.tp_third_party_testing: IEC 61853-1 Standard 7.6-2010: "Photovoltaic (PV) module performance testing and energy rating- Part 1: Irradiance and temperature performance measuremetns and power rating"

term.name: Maximum System Voltage
term.description: The maximum voltage of a fully assembled photovoltaic system for which the module is rated, or "the sum of the maximum open-circuit voltages of the maximum number of modules or panels to be connected in series in a system" (UL 1703 Standard 2.11-2004).

term.name: Maximum Stress Limit
term.description: The maximum force per area that the module has been tested to withstand. The value supplied describes "the ability of the module to withstand wind, snow, static or ice loads" (IEC 61215 Standard 10.16-2005 and IEC 61646 Standard 10.16-2008).
term.tp_third_party_testing: IEC 61215 Standard 10.16-2005: "Crystalline silicon terrestrial photovoltaic (PV) modules- Design qualification and type approval" and IEC 61646 Standard 10.16-2008: "Thin-film terrestrial photovoltaic (PV) modules- Design qualification and type approval"

term.name: Rated Hail Diameter Impact Resistance
term.description: The diameter size of hail that the module has been tested to withstand. IEC 61215 Standard 10.17-2005: "Crystalline silicon terrestrial photovoltaic (PV) modules- Design qualification and type approval" and IEC 61646 Standard 10.17-2008: "Thin-film terrestrial photovoltaic (PV) modules- Design qualification and type approval" provide test methodologies which can be used to measure these values.
term.tp_third_party_testing: IEC 61215 Standard 10.17-2005: "Crystalline silicon terrestrial photovoltaic (PV) modules- Design qualification and type approval" and IEC 61646 Standard 10.17-2008: "Thin-film terrestrial photovoltaic (PV) modules- Design qualification and type approval"

term.name: Rated Hail Speed Impact Resistance
term.description: The velocity of hail, at the Rated Hail Diameter, that the module has been tested to withstand. IEC 61215 Standard 10.17-2005: "Crystalline silicon terrestrial photovoltaic (PV) modules- Design qualification and type approval" and IEC 61646 Standard 10.17-2008: "Thin-film terrestrial photovoltaic (PV) modules- Design qualification and type approval" provide test methodologies which can be used to measure these values.
term.tp_third_party_testing: IEC 61215 Standard 10.17-2005: "Crystalline silicon terrestrial photovoltaic (PV) modules- Design qualification and type approval" and IEC 61646 Standard 10.17-2008: "Thin-film terrestrial photovoltaic (PV) modules- Design qualification and type approval"

term.name: Manufacturer's Warranty Available
term.description: Is there a manufacturer's warranty available for the module?

term.name: Warranty Time Length
term.description: The number of years during which the warranty is held valid by the manufacturer.

term.name: Percent Pmp Guaranteed By The Warranty
term.description: The percentage of the initial maximum power rating at standard test conditions (STC) guaranteed to be produced by the module at the end of the warranty. STC is defined as light spectrum AM 1.5, module temperature of 25 °C, and 1000 W/m<sup>2</sup> irradiance (IEC 61853-1 standard 7.2-2010).
term.tp_third_party_testing: IEC 61853-1 Standard 7.2-2010: "Photovoltaic (PV) module performance testing and energy rating- Part 1: Irradiance and temperature performance measuremetns and power rating"

term.name: Electrical Performance Chart
term.description: A document detailing the module's short circuit current (I<sub>sc</sub>), open circuit voltage (V<sub>oc</sub>, power at maximum power point (P<sub>mp</sub>), and voltage at maximum power point (V<sub>mp</sub>) under various conditions. The information must be formatted in alignment with the provided template, and uploaded as a .xls. IEC 61853-1 Standard 8-2010: "Photovoltaic (PV) module performance testing and energy rating- Part 1: Irradiance and temperature performance measurements and power rating" provides a test methodology which can be used to measure these values.
term.tp_third_party_testing: IEC 61853-1 Standard 8-2010: "Photovoltaic (PV) module performance testing and energy rating- Part 1: Irradiance and temperature performance measurements and power rating"

term.name: Area
term.description: The total area of the module, including spaces between cells and the frame. Reference conditions are 1,000 W/m^2 insolation, 25°C.

term.name: Maximum Power Current
term.description: Reference maximum power current at the reference conditions. Reference conditions are 1,000 W/m^2 insolation, 25°C.

term.name: Maximum Power Voltage
term.description: Reference maximum power voltage at the reference conditions. Reference conditions are 1,000 W/m^2 insolation, 25°C.

term.name: Open Circuit Voltage
term.description: Reference open circuit voltage at the reference conditions. Reference conditions are 1,000 W/m^2 insolation, 25°C.

term.name: Short Circuit Current
term.description: Reference short circuit current at the reference conditions. Reference conditions are 1,000 W/m^2 insolation, 25°C.

term.name: OpenStudio Type
term.description: Type of OpenStudio Object

term.name: Manufacturer/Brand Owner
term.description: The name of the company that manufactures the product and/or that owns the product brand.

term.name: Brand
term.description: The brand name under which the submitted product is marketed and/or sold in the U.S. In some cases, this may be identical to the name of the manufacturer/brand owner.

term.name: Product Line/Family Name
term.description: If the product being submitted is part of a family of products or models, supply the product line or family name here. As an example, if the submission were an automobile, this field would contain the model name.

term.name: Model Number
term.description:
The unique model number used by the manufacturer/brand owner to identify the specific product being submitted to the Technology Performance Exchange. Sometimes referred to as "catalog number."
Model numbers should be entered in the same style as that used by the manufacturer/brand owner, including all applicable slashes (/) and dashes (-). If certain alphanumeric characters in the model number identify product variations that do not impact energy performance, please replace each of those alphanumeric characters with an asterisk (*) when entering the model number on this website. This convention reduces the need to submit separate forms for product variations that have identical performance data. However, if a subset, but not all options for a specific character in the model number do not affect energy performance, include all such options inside parentheses within the larger model/product number.
Example: Product family X uses product numbers that contain eight alphanumeric characters. The first three characters denote product variations that affect energy performance; a subset of options denoted by the fourth character do not affect performance; and the last four characters do not affect energy performance at all. The manufacturer/brand owner would submit a separate "Add Product" form for each unique combination of the first four characters that affect energy performance; on each form, the submitted model numbers would have the form: ABC(1,2,3)****, ABC4****, ABC5****, etc.

term.name: Universal Product Code
term.description: If provided, the user must submit all 12 digits without spaces or dashes.

term.name: ENERGY STAR Label
term.description: Indicate whether the product has earned the ENERGY STAR label.

term.name: ENERGY STAR Version Number
term.description: List the version number of the most current ENERGY STAR specification under which the product earned the ENERGY STAR label.
term.tp_additional_web_dev_info: Values should include a tenths place digit (e.g., "4.0", or "5.1").

term.name: FEMP Designated Product
term.description: Indicate whether the product currently meets the energy performance requirements necessary to be identified as a Federal Energy Management Program-designated product.

term.name: OpenStudio Type
term.description: Type of OpenStudio Object

term.name: Volume per Cycle
term.description: Amount of water used per cycle of the fixture.

term.name: Rated Flow Rate
term.description: Rated volumetric flow rate of the water fixture.

term.name: Cycle Length
term.description: Length of the sink cycle for electronic faucets.

term.name: Faucet Type
term.description: An indicator of whether or not this faucet requires a power supply.

term.name: Power Supply
term.description: The type of power supply required by an electronic faucet.

term.name: OpenStudio Type
term.description: Type of OpenStudio Object

term.name: Rated Flow Rate
term.description: Rated volumetric flow rate of the water fixture.

term.description: Type of OpenStudio Object

term.name: Volume per Cycle
term.description: Amount of water used per flush.

term.name: Flush Type
term.description: Whether the fixture can be flushed using varying volumes of water.

term.name: Volume per Cycle
term.description: Amount of water used per flush.

level_1.name: Service Water Heating
level_1.description: Technology categories contained in the Service Water Heating group pertain to products used to heat water or those products that support the delivery of heated water, and whose primary purpose is to support the use of heated water in open-systems such as sinks, showers, or dishwashing processes. Products whose primary function is to transfer energy to water for space conditioning or process heating applications are covered in the HVAC - Hydronic Heating subgroup.

level_2.name: Tank Water Heaters
level_2.description: The Tank Water Heater subgroup includes water heater products that use an internal storage tank to store heated water. Instantaneous, on-demand, and other tankless water heater products are not covered within this subgroup.

level_3.name: Heat Pump Water Heaters
level_3.description: This technology category encompasses water heater products that have storage tanks and use a vapor compression cycle as the primary means of heating the water in the tank. Products which use electric resistance auxiliary heaters are included. However, traditional water heaters (i.e., those that use electric resistance elements or a natural gas burner as the primary heating mechanism), remote water loop heat pump systems in which the vapor compression cycle is used to produce hot water and provide heating and cooling to other components/zones in a building, and heat pump water heaters that use non-electric supplemental heating fuels are excluded.

term.description: Type of OpenStudio Object

term.description: Indicate whether the product has earned the ENERGY STAR label.

term.name: FEMP Designated Product
term.description: Indicate whether the product currently meets the energy performance requirements necessary to be identified as a Federal Energy Management Program-designated product.

term.name: Rated Capacity
term.description: The heating capacity associated with the change in water temperature of the heat pump condenser coil at specified rated conditions (AHRI Standard 1301). This rating should be performed with the supplemental heater(s) disabled (heat pump only mode).

term.name: Rated Tank Volume
term.description: The manufacturer-rated (labeled) tank water storage capacity.

term.name: Actual Tank Volume
term.description: The actual tank water storage capacity. This often differs from the rated tank volume, as manufacturers are provided an allowance of up to 10% when reporting tank volume (Burch and Erikson 2012).

term.name: Storage Tank Height
term.description: The height of the storage tank itself, without any heat pump equipment included in the dimension.

term.name: Required Height Necessary for Installation
term.description: The nominal height of the tank, including any heat pump equipment and housing, but not including pipe connections.

term.name: Rated Coefficient of Performance
term.description: A ratio of the rated heat pump water heating capacity to the total input power, expressed as a dimensionless value (AHRI Standard 1301). This rating should be performed with the supplemental heater disabled (heat pump only mode), and at the rated conditions prescribed for this heat pump water heater system.

term.name: Rated Heat Pump Sensible Heat Ratio
term.description: The fraction of total energy transfer between the evaporator coil and air that is associated with sensible capacity (change in air temperature) expressed as a dimensionless value, and at the rated conditions prescribed for this heat pump water heater system.

term.name: Refrigerant Designation
term.description: The refrigerant used in this heat pump water heater unit.

term.name: Upper Supplemental Heater Capacity
term.description: The rated heating capacity of the uppermost supplemental heater.

term.name: Lower Supplemental Heater Capacity
term.description: If applicable, the rated heating capacity of the lower supplemental heater.

term.name: Parasitic Fuel Consumption Rate
term.description: The rate of parasitic fuel consumption by non-water heating equipment. Primarily, this will be composed of the electrical energy used for control and display purposes.

term.name: Rated Inlet Air Dry-Bulb Temperature
term.description: The air dry-bulb temperature entering the evaporator during the rating test. AHRI Standard 1301 specifies standard rating conditions with dry-bulb values of 35.0°C (95°F), 27.0°C (80.6°F), 10.0°C (50°F), or -8.5°C (16.7°F), although the standard allows for application ratings at non-standard conditions, provided they are labeled. The single value supplied here should correspond to the conditions used to calculate the rated capacity.

term.name: Rated Inlet Air Wet Bulb Temperature
term.description: The air wet-bulb temperature entering the evaporator during the rating test. AHRI Standard 1301 specifies standard rating conditions with dry-bulb values of 24.0°C (75.2°F), 21.8°C (71.2°F), 7.0°C (44.6°F), or -9.5°C (14.9°F), although the standard allows for application ratings at non-standard conditions, provided they are labeled. The single value supplied here should correspond to the conditions used to calculate the rated capacity.

term.name: Rated Air Volumetric Flow Rate
term.description: The airflow rate passing through the evaporator during rating testing. AHRI Standard 1301 does not specify a rating condition, so the manufacturer's specified or nominal condition should be used.

term.name: Off-Cycle Heat Loss Coefficient
term.description: The heat loss coefficient to ambient conditions. This is typically equivalent to the overall skin heat loss coefficient, which can be determined from knowledge of the heat transfer properties from the water in the tank to the ambient surroundings, an average tank water temperature, and an ambient temperature according to the equation Q = UA (T<sub>tank<\sub> - T<sub>ambient<\sub>). This can also be inferred if the tank skin thermal (conduction) resistance is known by supplementing the conduction resistance with values for film (convection) thermal resistance.
term.ip_written: British Thermal Units per hour per square foot per degree Fahrenheit
term.si_written: Watts per square meter per degree Celsius

term.name: Minimum Ambient Air Temperature for Compressor Operation
term.description: The minimum ambient operating temperature for the compressor. This can be inferred from the operating range of the heat pump. Below this value, the heat pump will not operate and the supplemental heating system is required to produce hot water, thus reducing the efficiency of the heat pump water heater.

term.name: Heat Pump Fan Total Efficiency
term.description: Overall evaporator fan efficiency, calculated as the ratio of the power delivered to the fluid by the fan blades to the electrical input power provided to the motor. It implicitly includes the motor and fan blade efficiencies. This should be reported at rated conditions.

term.name: Heat Pump Fan Rated Power Input
term.description: Evaporator fan input power at rated conditions.

term.name: Performance Map
term.description: A document detailing the HPWH's performance under various conditions. The information must be formatted in alignment with the provided template, and uploaded as an .xls.

term.name: HPWH Control Details
term.description: A document that provides additional product performance-related information pertaining to the unit control strategy. This information should include a description of the various operational modes available to the unit, along with detailed information related to cut-in and cut-out temperatures/times for heat pump and supplemental heater operation. This information must be formatted as a PDF file.

term.description: Type of OpenStudio Object

term.name: Maximum drybulb temperature
term.description: Maximum drybulb temperature

term.name: Windspeed
term.description: Windspeed

term.name: Dewpoint
term.description: Dewpoint: temperature below which water vapor will condense into liquid water

term.name: Enthalpy
term.description: Enthalpy: sum of internal energy plus the product of pressure and volume

level_2.name: Location
level_2.description: Weather station index number, assigned by the World Meteorological Organization

term.name: WMO
term.description: Weather station index number, assigned by the World Meteorological Organization

term.name: City
term.description: Weather station city or text identifier (sometimes this is more than city: "Zanesville municipal Ap" or "Climate Zone 9")

term.name: State
term.description: Weather station state

term.name: Country
term.description: Weather station country

term.name: License
term.description: License for the weather information. Example: ASHRAE

term.name: Elevation
term.description: Elevation of the weather station

term.name: Latitude
term.description: Latitude of the weather station

term.name: Longitude
term.description: Longitude of the weather station

term.name: Heating Degree Days base 18°C
term.description: Annual heating degree days. A heating degree day (HDD) is the number of degrees the daily average temperature lies below some base value (in this case 18°C). If the daily average temperature lies at or above the base temperature, the HDD for that day is zero. Annual Heating Degree Days is the sum of daily HDD over an entire year.

term.name: Cooling Degree Days base 18°C
term.description: Annual cooling degree days. A cooling degree day (CDD) is the number of degrees the daily average temperature lies above some base value (in this case 18°C). If the daily average temperature lies at or below the base temperature, the CDD for that day is zero. Annual Cooling Degree Days is the sum of daily CDD over an entire year.

term.name: Heating Degree Days base 10°C
term.description: Annual heating degree days. A heating degree day (HDD) is the number of degrees the daily average temperature lies below some base value (in this case 10°C). If the daily average temperature lies at or above the base temperature, the HDD for that day is zero. Annual Heating Degree Days is the sum of daily HDD over an entire year.

term.name: Cooling Degree Days base 10°C
term.description: Annual cooling degree days. A cooling degree day (CDD) is the number of degrees the daily average temperature lies above some base value (in this case 10°C). If the daily average temperature lies at or below the base temperature, the CDD for that day is zero. Annual Cooling Degree Days is the sum of daily CDD over an entire year.

term.name: Heating Degree Days base 50°F
term.description: Annual heating degree days. A heating degree day (HDD) is the number of degrees the daily average temperature lies below some base value (in this case 50°F). If the daily average temperature lies at or above the base temperature, the HDD for that day is zero. Annual Heating Degree Days is the sum of daily HDD over an entire year.

term.name: Cooling Degree Days base 50°F
term.description: Annual cooling degree days. A cooling degree day (CDD) is the number of degrees the daily average temperature lies above some base value (in this case 50°F). If the daily average temperature lies at or below the base temperature, the CDD for that day is zero. Annual Cooling Degree Days is the sum of daily CDD over an entire year.

term.name: Heating Degree Days base 65°F
term.description: Annual heating degree days. A heating degree day (HDD) is the number of degrees the daily average temperature lies below some base value (in this case 65°F). If the daily average temperature lies at or above the base temperature, the HDD for that day is zero. Annual Heating Degree Days is the sum of daily HDD over an entire year.

term.name: Cooling Degree Days base 65°F
term.description: Annual cooling degree days. A cooling degree day (CDD) is the number of degrees the daily average temperature lies above some base value (in this case 65°F). If the daily average temperature lies at or below the base temperature, the CDD for that day is zero. Annual Cooling Degree Days is the sum of daily CDD over an entire year.

term.name: Monthly mean db temperature
term.description: Average hourly dry bulb temperature per month over a year

term.name: Delta mean db temperature
term.description: Highest dry bulb temperature minus lowest dry bulb temperature recorded in a year

term.name: Standard Pressure at Elevation
term.description: Barometric pressure calculated at the weather station's elevation.

level_2.name: Water Mains Temperature
level_2.description: Method used to calculate the water main temperature

term.description: Type of OpenStudio Object

term.name: Water main calculation
term.description: Method used to calculate the water main temperature

level_1.name: Transformers
level_1.description: Technology categories contained in the Transformers group encompass "static electric device[s] consisting of a winding, or two or more coupled windings, with or without a magnetic core, for introducing mutual coupling between electric circuits. Transformers are extensively used in electric power systems to transfer power by electromagnetic induction between circuits at the same frequency, usually with changed values of voltage and current" (IEEE Std C57.12.80-2002).

level_2.name: Distribution Transformers
level_2.description: The Distribution Transformer subgroup includes transformers "for transferring electrical energy from a primary distribution circuit to a secondary distribution circuit or consumer's service circuit" (IEEE Std. C57.12.80-2002).

level_3.name: Low-Voltage, Dry Type Distribution Transformers
level_3.description: This technology category includes "distribution transformer[s] in which the core and coil assembly is immersed in a gaseous or dry compound insulating medium," and which have "a rated primary [and secondary] voltage of 600 V or less," and "a capacity of.15kVA to 2500 kVA" (NEMA Standard TP2).

If certain alphanumeric characters in the model number identify product variations that do not impact energy performance, please replace each of those alphanumeric characters with an asterisk (*) when entering the model number on this website. Example: Product family X uses product numbers that contain eight alphanumeric characters. The manufacturer/brand owner would submit a separate "Add Product" form for each unique combination of the first four characters that affect energy performance; on each form, the submitted model numbers would have the form: ABC(1,2,3)****, ABC4****, ABC5****, etc.

term.description: Indicate whether the product has earned the ENERGY STAR label.

term.tp_additional_web_dev_info: Values should include a tenths place digit (e.g., "4.0", or "5.1").

term.name: FEMP Designated Product
term.description: Indicate whether the product currently meets the energy performance requirements necessary to be identified as a Federal Energy Management Program-designated product.

term.name: Rated Power
term.description: The rated power of the transformer expressed in VA. ANSI/IEEE C57.12.01 - "Standard General Requirements for Dry-Type Distribution and Power Transformers, Including Those with Solid-Cast and/or Resin Encapsulated Windings" and IEEE Std C57.12.91 - "Standard Test Code for Dry-Type Distribution and Power Transformers" provide context and test methods that can be used to derive this parameter.
term.tp_third_party_testing: ANSI/IEEE C57.12.01 - Standard General Requirements for Dry-Type Distribution and Power Transformers, Including Those with Solid-Cast and/or Resin Encapsulated Windings; ANSI/IEEE C57.12.91 - Standard Test Code for Dry-Type Distribution and Power Transformers

term.name: Phase
term.description: The number of phases that comprise the transformer load.

term.name: Conductor Material
term.description: The material used as the transformer winding.

term.name: Full-Load Temperature Rise
term.description: The full-load temperature rise of the transformer windings above ambient temperature when the transformer is loaded at its nameplate power (EnergyPlus Input Output Reference, 2013). ANSI/IEEE C57.12.01 - "Standard General Requirements for Dry-Type Distribution and Power Transformers, Including Those with Solid-Cast and/or Resin Encapsulated Windings" and IEEE Std C57.12.91 - "Standard Test Code for Dry-Type Distribution and Power Transformers" provide context and test methods that can be used to derive this parameter.
term.tp_third_party_testing: ANSI/IEEE C57.12.01 - Standard General Requirements for Dry-Type Distribution and Power Transformers, Including Those with Solid-Cast and/or Resin Encapsulated Windings; ANSI/IEEE C57.12.91 - Standard Test Code for Dry-Type Distribution and Power Transformers

term.name: Eddy Current Load Loss Fraction
term.description: The percentage of total load losses resulting from eddy currents. NEMA Standards Publication TP-2 2005: "Standard Test Method for Measuring the Energy Consumption of Distribution Transformers" provides a test methodology for calculating eddy and ohmic losses, which can be used to calculate this value.
term.tp_third_party_testing: NEMA Standards Publication TP-2 2005: Standard Test Method for Measuring the Energy Consumption of Distribution Transformers

term.name: No-Load Loss
term.description: The no-load (core) losses. NEMA Standards Publication TP-2 2005: "Standard Test Method for Measuring the Energy Consumption of Distribution Transformers" provides a test methodology which can be used to calculate this value. The no-load losses are roughly constant and exist whenever the transformer is energized (EnergyPlus Input Output Reference, 2013).
term.tp_third_party_testing: NEMA Standards Publication TP-2 2005: Standard Test Method for Measuring the Energy Consumption of Distribution Transformers

term.name: Rated Load Loss
term.description: The total load loss at rated power and conditions. This is the sum of the ohmic and eddy current losses. Load losses vary with the square of the load being served by the transformer (EnergyPlus Input Output Reference, 2013). NEMA Standards Publication TP-2 2005: "Standard Test Method for Measuring the Energy Consumption of Distribution Transformers" provides a test methodology which can be used to calculate this value.
term.tp_third_party_testing: NEMA Standards Publication TP-2 2005: Standard Test Method for Measuring the Energy Consumption of Distribution Transformers

term.name: Nameplate Efficiency
term.description: The nameplate transformer efficiency when the transformer is operating at 35% of rated per-unit load and 75 °C. This value is expressed as a percentage (NEMA Standards Publication TP-2 2005: Standard Test Method for Measuring the Energy Consumption of Distribution Transformers).
term.tp_third_party_testing: NEMA Standards Publication TP-2 2005: Standard Test Method for Measuring the Energy Consumption of Distribution Transformers

term.name: Maximum Efficiency Point
term.description: The percentage of rated power at which the maximum transformer efficiency is obtained (EnergyPlus Input Output Reference, 2013).

term.name: Primary Voltage
term.description: The primary voltage entering the transformer, expressed in Volts.

term.name: Secondary Voltage
term.description: The secondary voltage leaving the transformer, expressed in Volts.

term.name: System Frequency
term.description: The system frequency for the transformer, expressed in Hz.

term.name: K-Factor Rating
term.description: Rating of the transformer's ability to safely operate with the harmonic currents generated by non-linear loads when tested to IEEE C57.110-2008 - "Recommended Practice for Establishing Liquid-Filled and Dry-Type Power and Distribution Transformer Capability When Supplying Non-sinusoidal Load Currents."
term.tp_third_party_testing: IEEE C57.110-2008: Recommended Practice for Establishing Liquid-Filled and Dry-Type Power and Distribution Transformer Capability When Supplying Non-sinusoidal Load Currents. Institute of Electrical and Electronics Engineers
